message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it deals with the fundamental problem of adversarial attacks on deep neural networks, which is a major concern in the field of machine learning. Additionally, the paper also discusses the comparison of two different classification techniques, Softmax and Openmax, which are commonly used in machine learning and computer vision tasks, indicating a focus on machine learning and computer vision. The paper also mentions the use of deep features captured at the penultimate layer, which suggests a possible association with the sub-categories of cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Furthermore, the paper discusses the vulnerability of DNNs to adversarial perturbations, which is a security concern and may indicate a connection to the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Finally, the paper proposes a novel approach, LOTS, which involves optimizing logits, indicating a possible connection to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
